column1: A man who was born on August 4, 1961, in Honolulu, Hawaii.
A man who served as the 44th president of the United States from 2009 to 2017.
A man who was the first African American to be elected president of the United States.
A man who graduated from Columbia University in 1983 with a degree in political science.
A man who worked as a community organizer in Chicago in the mid-1980s.
A man who graduated from Harvard Law School in 1991.
A man who was the first Black president of the Harvard Law Review.
A man who married Michelle Robinson in 1992.
A man who has two daughters, Malia and Sasha.
A man who taught constitutional law at the University of Chicago Law School from 1992 to 2004.
A man who published his memoir Dreams from My Father" in 1995."
A man who was elected to the Illinois State Senate in 1996.
A man who ran unsuccessfully for the U.S. House of Representatives in 2000.
A man who delivered the keynote address at the 2004 Democratic National Convention.
A man who was elected to the U.S. Senate from Illinois in 2004.
A man who announced his candidacy for president in February 2007.
A man who defeated Hillary Clinton for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2008.
A man who selected Joe Biden as his running mate in 2008.
A man who defeated John McCain in the 2008 presidential election.
A man who was inaugurated as president on January 20, 2009.
A man who was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2009.
A man who signed the Affordable Care Act into law in 2010.
A man who ordered the operation that killed Osama bin Laden in 2011.
A man who was reelected president in 2012, defeating Mitt Romney.
A man who supported the legalization of same-sex marriage in 2012.
A man who established the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program in 2012.
A man who negotiated the Iran nuclear deal in 2015.
A man who restored diplomatic relations with Cuba in 2015.
A man who signed the Paris Climate Agreement in 2016.
A man who left office with a 60% approval rating in January 2017.
A man who has a half-sister, Maya Soetoro-Ng.
A man who lived in Indonesia for several years as a child.
A man who was raised primarily by his maternal grandparents in Hawaii.
A man who wrote a second memoir, The Audacity of Hope
A man who won a Grammy Award for the audio version of his memoir.
A man who plays basketball and is left-handed.
A man who is a fan of the Chicago White Sox baseball team.
A man who initiated the Pivot to Asia" foreign policy strategy."
A man who ended the U.S. military's Don't Ask
A man who was named Time magazine's Person of the Year in 2008 and 2012.
A man who authorized the use of drones for targeted killings.
A man who established the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.
A man who signed the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.
A man who faced opposition from the Tea Party movement.
A man who negotiated and signed the New START treaty with Russia.
A man who withdrew most U.S. troops from Iraq by December 2011.
A man who increased troop levels in Afghanistan before later reducing them.
A man who called for universal preschool education.
A man who supported net neutrality rules.
A man who established the My Brother's Keeper initiative to address opportunity gaps for young men of color.
A man who launched the Precision Medicine Initiative.
A man who commuted the sentences of 1,715 individuals, primarily for non-violent drug offenses.
A man who received honorary degrees from over a dozen universities.
A man who chaired the G20 summit in 2009 during the financial crisis.
A man who formed a production company with his wife called Higher Ground Productions.
A man who signed a multi-year deal with Netflix to produce films and series.
A man who published his presidential memoir A Promised Land" in 2020."
A man who has been among the most admired men in America according to Gallup polls.
A man who launched the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act to combat the Great Recession.
A man who created the White House Office of Social Innovation and Civic Participation.
A man who expanded the Children's Health Insurance Program.
A man who established the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act to improve school lunches.
A man who supported the overthrow of Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi.
A man who faced criticism for his administration's response to the Syrian Civil War.
A man who created the Brain Research through Advancing Innovative Neurotechnologies (BRAIN) Initiative.
A man who established the U.S. Digital Service to improve government websites.
A man who normalized relations with Myanmar.
A man who visited Hiroshima, becoming the first sitting U.S. president to do so.
A man who removed Cuba from the state sponsors of terrorism list.
A man who signed the Every Student Succeeds Act, replacing No Child Left Behind.
A man who created the College Scorecard to help students compare schools.
A man who established the Task Force on 21st Century Policing.
A man who declared the Bears Ears and Gold Butte National Monuments.
A man who protected more land and water than any previous president.
A man who banned solitary confinement for juvenile offenders in federal prisons.
A man who supported transgender students' right to use bathrooms matching their gender identity.
A man who established the Cancer Moonshot initiative led by Vice President Biden.
A man who signed the Food Safety Modernization Act.
A man who created the Cybersecurity National Action Plan.
A man who opened relations with Myanmar.
A man who was the subject of birther" conspiracy theories."
A man who lifted the ban on federal funding for stem cell research.
A man who expanded overtime pay eligibility for workers.
A man who signed the Credit Card Accountability, Responsibility, and Disclosure Act.
A man who created the White House Council on Women and Girls.
A man who established the National Ocean Policy.
A man who supported marriage equality in an interview with Robin Roberts in 2012.
A man who endorsed Hillary Clinton for president in 2016.
A man who made a historic visit to Cuba in 2016.
A man who expanded the Papahānaumokuākea Marine National Monument in Hawaii.
A man who had a pet dog named Bo, and later added another Portuguese Water Dog named Sunny.
A man who smoked cigarettes before quitting during his first presidential campaign.
A man who created the Let Girls Learn initiative with his wife.
A man who frequently released summer reading lists and playlists.
A man who appeared on comedian Zach Galifianakis's Between Two Ferns" to promote healthcare.gov."
A man who has a species of lichen named after him (Caloplaca obamae).
A man who established the Organizing for Action nonprofit.
A man who lives in Washington, D.C.'s Kalorama neighborhood after his presidency.
A man who delivered a eulogy at John Lewis's funeral in 2020.
A man who launched the Obama Foundation to inspire and empower the next generation of leaders.
